definition: to neglect/to trifle with/not to take seriously
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
to neglect/to overlook/to ignore/suddenly
surname Hu
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice

sentences.english: Regulators dozing Homer Simpson-like at the switch?
sentences.chinese: 难道是监管者像荷马。辛普森那样玩忽职守？

sentences.english: He was sharply reprimanded for his negligence.
sentences.chinese: 他因玩忽职责而受到严厉的申斥。

sentences.english: causing losses to archives as a result of neglect of duty on the part of archivists.
sentences.chinese: 档案工作人员玩忽职守，造成档案损失的。

sentences.english: Grief dallied with nor law nor limit knows.
sentences.chinese: 痛苦若遭到玩忽，会凌越法度和界限。

sentences.english: He usually is a very loyal employee but occasionally he lies down on the job.
sentences.chinese: 他通常是一位很忠实的受雇者，但偶尔也会玩忽职守。

sentences.english: The city man ager says the suits may claim negligence by the town and its employees.
sentences.chinese: 市领导称这起诉讼可能会判该镇及其职员玩忽职守罪。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of gross dereliction of duty.
The official was dismissed for neglect of his duty.
sentences.chinese: 这名官员因玩忽职守而遭开除。

sentences.english: The boss fired him out for neglect of his duty.
sentences.chinese: 老板以玩忽职守为由把他开除了。

sentences.english: I don't trust him, for he often neglects his duty.
sentences.chinese: 我不信任他，因为他常常玩忽职守。

sentences.english: Differs from negligence in that the victim does not have to prove negligence by the injurer.
sentences.chinese: 与玩忽不同的是受害者并没有检测出玩忽的伤害。

sentences.english: Differs from negligence in that the victim does not have to prove negligence by the injurer.
sentences.chinese: 与玩忽不同的是受害者并没有检测出玩忽的伤害。

sentences.english: The head nurse was reduced to ordinary nurse due to malpractice.
sentences.chinese: 这位护士长由于玩忽职守被降职为普通护士。

sentences.english: Oppositions MPs charged the minister with neglecting her duty.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员指责女部长玩忽职守。

sentences.english: We accused him of having neglected his duty.
Neglect of duty is good cause for removal of a trustee.
sentences.chinese: 玩忽职守是干掉受委托人的最佳理由。

definition: to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
to neglect
wrongdoing/failure to do one's duty
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty
duty/responsibility/post
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to neglect one's duties
to circumvent the law
to abscond/to be absent without leave
fault/mistake/shortcoming/error/misconduct
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
law and order/rules and discipline
to carry out one's duties perfunctorily/to fulfill one's responsibility
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to fail in observing or supervising/to miss/to let sth slip through
to exceed one's authority/to go beyond the bounds of one's job
